p.s: Sonnet 138 or When my love swears that she is made of truth written byShakespeare deals with how the speaker's beloved person treats him.
at first the speaker is complaining that his lover lies about loving him, although he claims that he believsbelieves her.
He states the she thinks of him as an inexperienced young person, that is why she lies about the truth of their relationship.
Although he knows about her lies, this does not bother him, because on the both sides the truth is suppressed.
The speaker asks himself why does not she tell the truth.
His answer is trust plays aan important role in love.
As he knows that she thinks of him as a young inexperienced man, the speaker admits that they are pretending to be somebody else and their relationship is based on lies.
